title: Ticket #7360: macro default does not allow - character and workaround is broken
description:
Michael Pelletier reports: "The following leaves the trailing ")" at the end of the BASENAME macro's output when expanding." 

IMAGE_FILE = $(IMAGE_FILE:/user/1127883/DOCKER/singularity/c5-tf-container.simg)
IMAGE_BASE = $BASENAME(IMAGE_FILE)

MY.ImageBasename = "$(IMAGE_BASE)"

hold = true

executable = /bin/sleep
arguments = $(IMAGE_BASE)

queue

:!condor_q 29243 -af args ImageBasename
c5-tf-container.simg)
c5-tf-container.simg)
remarks:
2020-Mar-09 16:12:08 by johnkn:
The problem here is that IMAGE_FILE is not self-substituting in the first line so it's value ends up being 
$(IMAGE_FILE:/user/1127883/DOCKER/singularity/c5-tf-container.simg)
which looks to the $BASENAME function like file with a URL prefix of $(IMAGE_FILE: and a file extension of .simg)

It turns out the actual problem here is the use of - in the filename. This is not a legal character to follow the : in the $(name:default) pattern, the use of - causes the parser to skip over the entire $() expansion thinking that it is not actually a $() expansion.

There is an intended work-around 

DEF_IMAGE=/user/1127883/DOCKER/singularity/c5-tf-container.simg
IMAGE_FILE=$(IMAGE_FILE:$(DEF_IMAGE))

But there is a bug that prevents that from working.

For now, your workaround should be 

if !defined IMAGE_FILE
  IMAGE_FILE = /user/1127883/DOCKER/singularity/c5-tf-container.simg
endif
